title: Configure authorization for Cloud Cost Reporting
content:
This topic explains how to configure authorization for Cloud Cost Reporting in both Cloud Management and Operations Cloud. Each application uses its own roles and groups. Users who work across both areas must have roles in both applications.

Assign roles to groups, and then add users to groups rather than assigning roles directly to individuals. This makes administration easier when team members change.

Cloud Management authorization

Cloud Management authorization controls who can:

  • configure cloud cost data providers, and

  • access Cloud Operations to view or manage cloud accounts.

Out-of-the-box (OOTB) roles and groups in Cloud Management

The following OOTB roles support Cloud Cost Reporting:

  • CMP Agent - Provides access to Service Design and Deployment, Cloud Cost Reporting, and Operations Orchestration.
  • CGRO Administrator - Provides access to Cloud Cost Reporting functionality.

The following OOTB group supports Cloud Cost Reporting:

  • CGRO Administrators - Provides access to Cloud Cost Reporting functionality. By default, this group is assigned the CGRO Administrator role.

Default CGRO administrators in Cloud Management

The following users are automatically added to the CGRO Administrators group in a Cloud Cost Reporting-enabled tenant:

  • the Cloud Cost Reporting admin user specified when enabling the Cloud Cost Reporting capability, and

  • the tenant administrator assigned to the tenant when a suite admin creates the tenant.

A Service Management tenant admin created later by assigning the Tenant Admin role does not automatically get added to the CGRO Administrators group. If needed, you must add the user to the CGRO Administrators group manually.

Update the CGRO Administrators group

To allow members of the CGRO Administrators group to access Cloud Cost Reporting functionality through the menu, assign the CMP Agent role to this group.

Tenant administrators can assign roles to groups. For details on how to assign roles to groups, see Groups.

Add custom roles and groups in Cloud Management

To support Cloud Cost Reporting operations, you must create additional custom roles.

Add custom roles

We recommend you to add custom roles in a development tenant and import them into the production tenant using the Dev2Prod functionality. 

Tenant administrators can add custom roles.

To add a custom role with the Application value SMAX:

  1. Navigate to Administration > Master Data > People > Roles.
  2. Click Add.
  3. Select SMAX from the Application field.
  4. Enter a name and a code for the role.
  5. Click OK.
  6. Assign required permissions to the role.

The following describes the custom roles you should add and their permissions.

Role
(Example name)

 Permissions
CMP Cloud Account Administrator

Select Update and View for the Cloud Account record type.

CMP Cloud Integration Administrator

You must have the Integration Administrator role.

Add groups

Tenant administrators can add groups.

To add a group:

  1. Navigate to Administration > Master Data > People > Groups.
  2. Click New.

The following describes the groups you should add and the roles to assign to the groups.

Group
(Example name)

 Roles

CMP Cloud Cost Administrators
CGRO Administrator and
CMP Cloud Account Administrator
CMP Cloud Integration Administrators
CGRO Administrator and CMP Cloud Integration Administrator

Operations Cloud authorization

Operations Cloud authorization controls who can:
• upload and view prebuilt Cloud Cost Reports, and
• create custom reports.

Built-in Operations Cloud roles

The following built-in Operations Cloud roles support Cloud Cost Reporting:

Role Purpose
bvd_admin Upload Cloud Cost Reports package and create custom Flex reports.
DefaultBVDRole View prebuilt Cloud Cost Reports.

Personas in Cloud Cost Reporting and required roles

This section describes the personas involved in Cloud Cost Reporting and maps them to the roles they need in Cloud Management and Operations Cloud.

Cloud cost team owners

Cloud cost team owners are mainly responsible for understanding the cloud spend associated with the services, applications, or business units they manage. They use Cloud Cost Reporting to view spending trends and analyze cost patterns.

These users access the reporting content and do not perform configuration or administrative tasks.

They correspond to personas such as product owners, engineering leads, business operations managers.

Cloud cost administrators

Cloud cost administrators require a broad view of spending across the organization. Their responsibilities may include:

  • reviewing overall cloud costs and spending patterns
  • identifying cost drivers and spending anomalies
  • identifying contacts for various cloud accounts for spending anomalies
  • creating custom reports

They correspond to personas such as FinOps practitioners, IT finance managers, Procurement managers, and organizational leadership roles (for example, CEO, CTOs etc.)

Cloud integration administrators

Cloud integration administrators are responsible for setting up and managing the integrations that retrieve cloud billing data and cloud account information.

​​​​​Role mapping by persona

Persona Cloud Management roles Operations Cloud roles
Cloud cost team owners No Cloud Management role required DefaultBVDRole to view Cloud Cost Reports
Cloud cost administrators Add to the CMP Cloud Cost Administrators group   bvd_admin 
Cloud integration administrators Add to the CMP Cloud Integration Administrators group No Operations Cloud role required

Assign roles or groups to users

To assign roles or groups to users in Cloud Management, see Users and contacts. Tenant administrators can assign roles or groups to users.
To assign roles to users in Operations Cloud, see Add roles to users. Users with the SUPER_IDM_ADMIN role can assign roles.

For more information about roles and groups in Cloud Management, see Roles and Groups.
For more information about roles in Operations Cloud, see Manage roles.
